stem: Given question: James constructed a playroom for his children.   His place was small, so he put it in an unattached what? and answer: building, explain why in
no_more_50_words: James' house wasn't large enough for him to subdivide an existing room to serve as a playroom. To have enough room, he had to construct the playroom in a different, unattached building, like a garage.
150_to_200_words:
James constructed a playroom for his children in an unattached building because it was the most efficient use of his limited space. An unattached building is an independent structure that does not share walls or a roof with adjacent buildings, making it an ideal choice for utilizing a small space. Unattached buildings can be built in a variety of styles and sizes, allowing James to choose the one that best suited the needs of his children.

Additionally, an unattached building is usually more affordable to construct than a traditional structure. James was able to take advantage of this cost savings and invest the funds saved into the playroom itself. He was able to equip the playroom with a variety of fun and educational toys and activities for his children to enjoy.

Furthermore, an unattached building offers the added benefit of allowing James to control the temperature and humidity of the playroom. This was important because some of the toys and activities he provided required specific temperature and humidity levels to be maintained in order to ensure the safety and enjoyment of his children.
